item.title: Potholes on Erith Road from house no 210 upto 236., 14th February
item.description:
These potholes have been there for months now and need urgent fix. Heavy vehicles going past our homes are causing more damage to the road and also affecting our homes to shudder when they pass through. The potholes are also causing damage to our cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 230, Erith Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ///slows.copper.epic collect purple bags, 14th February
item.description:
I found 3 frames in Playdell Avenue and moved them to the spot where litter picking bags were left this morning. Please collect. Thank you The exact location is ///slows.copper.epic

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Traffic island damaged, 14th February
item.description:

item.title: Car collision debris - Astbury Rd / Loder St junction, 14th February
item.description:
A vehicle collided with parked cars on Astbury Road in the early hours of Friday 13 February 2026. There is debris from this collision on Astbury Road, from the junction with Loder St, and along Colls Rd.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Astbury Road, Peckham, Greater London

item.title: Stairs disgusting and unsafe, 14th February
item.description:
The stairs in the car park continue to be in a state of disrepair, with litter, chewing gum, broken edges of steps, and terrible smells. I understand it is owned and maintained by the council. Please can it be taken care of? It feels unsafe for children and the elderly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Way, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish still there despite twice being informed issue "resolved", 14th February
item.description:
Rubbis still present despite twice being informed issue "resolved" Reported three time and had it confirmed that the problem has been fixed. How the rubbish / sofa is slowly being spread out down the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarence Mews, Hackney, London

item.title: Tennis courts flooded - cleaning needed, 14th February
item.description:
The tennis courts in Vauxhall park are flooded and can’t be used. Cleaning of the surface will improve drainage through the layers. This has been shown to work in the last - pressure wash required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fentiman Road, Vauxhall, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pile of black bags and boxes on April Street E8, 14th February
item.description:
Hello, please can you remove the large pile of rubbish and black bags and boxes on April street E8 This is also blocking the pavement and is a tripping hazard. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): April Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Sainsbury’s trolleys abandoned outside store, 14th February
item.description:
Sainsbury’s now abandon their trolleys outside the store. Preventing people from using the footpath and accessing the ATM and causing the area to look a mess. Please sort.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83-89, Queen's Road, Peckham, Greater London
